primary_changes: Removed Filter button component with secondary variant styling
Removed wrapper Box container that was grouping SearchField and Filter button
Refactored layout: SearchField now directly positioned instead of nested in flex container
file_insights.impact: UI simplification - reduced visual complexity in the contacts header section

patterns_discovered.description: When removing UI components, their associated icon imports are also removed, preventing dead code accumulation
Removing a button from a grouped flex layout required restructuring the parent Box container and its flex properties
The SearchField component is now the only element in its container position, suggesting potential for further simplification

gotchas_discovered.description: The flex container that wrapped SearchField and Filter button had to be removed entirely, exposing the SearchField directly to the parent layout's space-between logic
gotchas_discovered.resolution: SearchField was left as direct child with space-between parent still functioning correctly for chip alignment

gotchas_discovered.description: Unlike the Filter button removal, there was no associated filter state management code to remove, suggesting the filter functionality may have been already disabled or non-functional
gotchas_discovered.implication: Filter logic may still exist in the component but is orphaned

approach_outcome.strategy: Direct removal approach - eliminate the Filter button component and its associated import, then restructure the layout wrapper
approach_outcome.notes: Straightforward removal with minimal collateral changes. The SearchField remains functional and properly aligned. No TypeScript errors or prop issues introduced.

recommendations.suggestion: Review if any filter-related state (hooks, props, handlers) still exists in the component and should be removed for complete cleanup
Consider if SearchField should be wrapped in its own Box with flex properties since it's now a direct child, or if current margin/padding is adequate
Verify SearchField functionality remains intact and layout doesn't break on different screen sizes since flex wrapper was removed
